diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of appendicitis was supported by the patient's symptoms of abdominal pain that progressed to focal right lower quadrant tenderness, nausea, and vomiting. Imaging findings from the CT abdomen and pelvis indicated a dilated appendix measuring 19 mm, fluid-filled with an appendicolith, and significant periappendiceal fat stranding, without evidence of abscess or perforation.
